description: a(n) has exactly n anagrams that are primes.
comments: An anagram is a permutation of digits not beginning with 0
mathematica: ap[n_] := Count[FromDigits /@ Select[Permutations[IntegerDigits[n]], First[#] != 0 &], _?PrimeQ]; t = {1}; Do[i = 1; While[ap[i] != n, i++]; AppendTo[t, i], {n, 30}]; t (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jun 29 2013 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
